column3: School of Mathematical and Computer Sciences
column5: This programme imparts the understanding and skills to develop advanced software systems to professional standards.The programme has a flexible structure to suit graduates with a wide spectrum of degrees from those in IT to those with rather less academic computing content. The MSc covers core skills in Information Technology (IT) at MSc level while allowing students to study specialist advanced courses in topics such as animation, databases, e-commerce, games programming, intelligent robotics and network applications.
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
column9: 9-12 months full time, 2 years part time
